review_body: On a whim I took my 3 kids and myself to HI. I used Hotwire to book and got this hotel. I enjoyed my stay and found it to be family friendly (the pool was a huge hit for my kids!), the decor and aesthetic was very Hawaiian, and the walk to the beach was quick! The staff were amazing and went above and beyond to make our short stay memorable. My only gripe is the pushy timeshare people. Even with my youngest having a meltdown the lady wouldn’t stop trying to get me to attend the meeting, spend $ to go, etc. it made me feel uncomfortable leaving the lobby since we had to go past her.

First room too noisy bed not made up for our children and no linen supplied for us. Not enough towels for four people. Noisy as re neighbours. Second room rain coming in thru window fridge leaked waited two hour for room to be cleaned nothing was said as to why we had to wait. Third room smelt musty wet carpet from bathroom into main room. None of the rooms we could open ranchsliders. Staff were excellent though at front desk. The hotel is far too old and needs to be refurbished.

PRO'S - close to waikiki beach - close to main street - friendly staff (Events - Aaron was very helpful) - lay out of 2 bedroom suite great - close to launderette - across the road from ALAMO car rental - close proximity to PINK LINE trolley service - kitchen had a fridge, 2 burner electric stove, mini microwaveCON'S - hotel=old -hotel=needs desperate updating - room - sticky carpet (probs due to humidity) - room - mould on shower door - room - found ear buds (about 20) behind bed - room - initially had 3 of everything (ie cutlery, crockery, towells, beach towells) we booked for 5 people. Took 36 hours and a second reminder to finally deliver to room - room - windows in the 2 bedrooms were siliconed shut - room - found hair (not ours) in shower, on pillows, on carpet. - room - not cleaned thourougly everyday. - beds not made properly (sheets not tucked in ) - found hair in bedroom drawers (not ours) - room - did not supply sheets for duvet bed (even after asking) - room - shower was dark (needed to leave shower door open to see)

We were very disappointed in the condition of the rooms in this hotel. We have stayed at other Outrigger Hotels in the past and have always felt they were a great mid-range hotel. Unfortunately this one needs some serious updating. The rooms were spacious and the bed was comfortable, but the wallpaper was peeling, the grout in the bathroom was dirty, the shower door would not close and the baseboards and trim work were all banged up. We also had reserved a King Room, but upon check in, were told None were available, and also no Queen's. We had no choice but to accept double beds. Not at all happy about that. However, on the upside, the price was reasonable for Waikiki and the location was Fantastic. Very close to all major shopping, eating places and the Beach. It was OK for a two day layover, but that's about it.

This was a decent hotel. It was clean and the staff were friendly. The room had a minifridge, toaster and microwave so we had breakfast in our room to help to reduce costs.We had a king sized bed which was quite comfortable.From this location it was only a couple of blocks from Waikiki beach and many shops and restaurants. We were moved from our original room as the air conditioner was producing a constant drip of water onto the carpet and we couldn't open our balcony door. The staff was quite accommodating and the move was not difficult.The swimming pool was quite cold (I don't think it was heated) so we didn't use it as much as we would have liked. The hot tub was comfortable. I only gave this hotel 3 stars because of the noisy construction going on next door and across the street. Noise from the construction started most mornings before 7am. I know this is not the fault of our hotel but its something for a visitor to consider if going to Honolulu in the near future. The construction in both locations is just starting so will likely be ongoing for some time.I note that all of the hotels charge an "ammenity" fee. The fee for this hotel was $20.00 US per night and charged when you check out of the hotel. I think this fee is underhanded and a hidden fee to make the hotel more money while making their room price appear more reasonable. I would much rather have hotels be upfront about the total cost of a room in their advertised pricing as opposed to adding this fee to the fine print. Be careful when looking into hotels as this fee of $20.00 was one of the lower fees for hotels in the area. This can add quite a cost to your holiday.

Great Experience here.... room service was on time and good privacy. Great and helpful stuff and sufficient room space. Would recommend for family stays and vacation. One of the stuff even helped me get my food heated up .

This was the third time we had the pleasure of staying at the Ohana Waikiki East. Each time we had a great experience. Not only did we get a clean comfortable room with excellent service, but also I believe we got one of the best deals in Waikiki. It helped that we used Hotwire's Mystery Hotel deal. Guessing the hotel is pretty easy by the way. We did use the Gym, beach towels, and the restaurant for breakfast. We also had a balcony for early morning and late evening relaxation. Daytime can be a little hot. The hotel is conveniently located to excellent shopping, public transportation, and of course, the Waikiki Beach. Another perk was the free use of the Pink Line Double Decker tour bus. The staff at the front desk was particularly friendly and extremely helpful. Highly reccomended.

I read a lot of the reviews before booking this hotel and all of them said a great location, all main sites are a walkable distance. I don't walk a lot and I can say that this hotel is close to everything! Waikiki Beach is less than a 5 minute walk at a nice leisurely pace. Main drag with shops and markets is a 4 minute walk. The hotel is still stuck in the 80s with it's decor but it has everything you need and is clean! So who cares?

This is the first time that we stayed more of the center of Waikiki and we didn't like it. The streets are noise at night from the buses. The mattress is not comfortable at all.We arrive early,they didn't let us in our room because was early but if we pay 70 dollars no problem. I have never experienced something like that before.

This is my second stay at the ohana east and once again for the price this is an great place to stay.Close to the beach and shops. We had a nice quiet room. Small shower didn’t bother us, and this time we had a kitchenette, which was great for reheating leftovers and in room dinners.Thank you!Hope to be back!

I cannot recommend staying in apartment 1823. There was no cool air con working and when we checked out the vents they were black and disgustingly filthy. The room whilst clean (thanks to great housekeeping) is very very old, tired and worn out. What makes it even worse at checkin we were told it was a great room one of the best! I gave feedback to management in survey that I do not think they should be renting the room out at all. The kitchenette is a joke if a family staying here are wanting to cook a lot of meals with only an electric fry pan for cooking (there is a microwave) you would have to cook in batches!The bathroom is functional, shower curtains (who has them in this day and age) actually were doubled and so don’t cling which was a blessing and the detachable shower head was a bonus. Probably the best thing about the whole apartment!The bedroom is a nice size and king bed to boot, as long as you sleep on the window side. Unfortunately I didn’t so I had to contend with a distinct downwards slope to the outside. The sitting room or another bedroom as it has a sofa bed was very large. With it being at the end there were windows on two walls so made for a very sunny filled room - except had to keep the curtains drawn as so hot with no cool air con. The lanai was a nice size and full size table and chairs. But again very old and tattered looking. With no sun shade though, wasn’t pleasant sitting outside for too long. There were lovely views could see the beach and water amongst the hotels closer to the beach.As other reviews say it’s in a great location about 5 mins walk to the beach and about 2 mins walk to the International Market. Plenty of cafes & restaurants - we found a great one called Basalt checkout the cocktail Cool Burn! The cafe in the hotel serves good coffee (which is quite hard to find in Hawaii).Whilst I would never ever return to this hotel unless it was seriously remodeled or even demolished and rebuilt, I would like to call out Housekeeping for Level 18 - they were very friendly and honest.We moved to other accommodation after 4 nights. I am so grateful we only had to stay here for a family event for 4 nights because if this had been my introduction to Hawaiian hotel accommodation I would have returned home with a sour taste in my mouth.Other family members stayed in suite 1923 (marginally better air con working) and Room 928 which had amazing cool aircon. We just drew the short straw but didn’t let it spoil our holiday.Floors 18 and 19 are serviced by an express elevator which unfortunately is being upgraded so we rode the service elevator very classy not! But got to meet the delightful staff who were all very pleasant and welcoming - even when the elevator stank of rubbish Please, if this doesn’t put you off staying here enjoy your stay and I hope you get a nice cool room .

We had high expectations for this resort but we were disappointed. The hotel is very outdated. It feels as if it is straight out of the 1970s. The halls are narrow and dingy with scuffed walls. The bathrooms are very small. We were originally placed next to the elevators but 3 hours into our stay we realized that we would not be able to sleep with all that noise and requested a room change. We got moved to an even smaller room. We can still hear toilets flushing in surrounding rooms and hear the loud traffic outside. The bathroom had sand on the floor. It is close to all the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. Check in staff, especially Jessie, were friendly and helpful. Will not be staying here again however.

Great spot, just back from the beach but an easy walk. Close to all the handy stuff. A busy hotel but everything seems organised. We were on the top floor so needed to use the Service Lift... not sure what that was all about.

But not the last. The Ohana Waikiki east by outrigger was a great value. Very close to the Main Street and the beach. On arrival Pono welcomes us at the front desk and upon learning it was our first visit he went into the back office and emerged with a beautiful lei for my husband and I. What a sweet gesture and welcome. As we arrived late in the evening we went to our room right away. We decided to pop out to the store across the street and were surprised at how warm it was. The next morning we went to the front desk to ask about upgrading our room. There was nothing wrong with the room we were in it was just close to the elevator and my husband is a very light sleeper. Brian was so great, he took the time to look for something for us and found us a room on the 17th floor that was perfect. We are already telling our friends and family about this location for their trips as well as planning our next visit. Aloha

As a member of a national hotel brand guest loyalty program, I would usually stay at one of their properties in Waikiki. But for this trip, I decided to walk away from the lavish resort amenities and chose to stay at a budget friendly hotel. After researching online, I was lucky to find a hotel with a great location in Waikiki and, a nightly rate plus amenities that's exclusively offered to kama'ainas or Hawai'i residents like myself. The Ohana East Hotel by Outrigger, located on the corner of Kai'ulani and Kuhio Avenue in Waikiki. I'm very familiar with the Outrigger Enterprises Group, a hotel management company that was started in Hawai'i 72 years ago by Mr. Roy Kelley, who had a vision to offer family-friendly hotel rooms in Waikiki. Through the company's Ke Ano Wa'a program, a cultural enriching program that starts with educating and investing into the team members first, then into the hotel property design, this unique style of perpetuating the rich culture of the Hawaiian islands then embraces each guest during their stay. Through the years, the company's portfolio has grown to include properties outside of Hawai'i along with brands such as Ohana by Outrigger. I arrived by airport shuttle, curbside in front of the hotel was busy with other vehicles. The bellman welcomed me with a warm greeting and gave me directions to the front desk to check in, as I rode the escalator to the first floor. A small, yet decorated air conditioned lobby boasted a full-scale outrigger canoe for observation, colorful carpet and art hanging from the walls and, comfortable chairs with cushions as hotel guests moved about or relaxed. I walked to the front desk where I was embraced with a smile and warm greeting. Although I had arrived earlier than the check-in time, the front desk agent was nice enough to assign me to a room that was available and before I knew it, I was unpacking in my hotel room. The hotel room, basic yet clean with well appointed furnishings. No bathtub but with a shower, the room also came with ample amounts of closet space, a refrigerator, coffee maker, in-room safe, flat screen TV and a table with two chairs. Daily housekeeping kept our hotel room clean and I made sure to leave a gratuity daily even though I was staying at a budget friendly hotel. Beach/pool towels were in the hotel room, changed daily if used. Part of the amenities offered with the special nightly rate for Hawai'i residents included a Ohana Hotels drawstring bag, two complimentary Mai Tai's, a coupon booklet, complimentary parking and complimentary rides on the Pink Line throughout Waikiki and to Ala Moana Center. The Pink Line, operated by another Hawai'i company, E Noa Tours, is a double-decker bus that travels into Waikiki with multiple stops and to the Ala Moana Center, with over 350 stores and restaurants. Riding the Pink Line was so convenient and fun, as I sat on the top of the two-story bus and enjoyed the views and cool breeze. The location of the hotel is also extremely convenient, just steps from the beach and located in the "heart of Waikiki", where in less than five minutes walking distance, I could be at the International Marketplace or the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center. Because the hotel is not located on a side street away from the traffic and crowds, it's safe to venture off-property in all directions when leaving the property. When I wasn't eating or shopping, or just cruising around Waikiki, I enjoyed the jacuzzi and pool at the hotel. Although the pool was not as elaborate like other resort properties in Waikiki, the hotel pool had a decent amount of lounge chairs where I was able to sunbathe and, having a jacuzzi to relax in was a great way to unwind after a day full of walking.If you're a Hawai'i resident and are searching for a hotel property that offers a great location with convenience, a clean hotel room with great amenities, affordable nightly rates if purchased at the time reserved with no cancellation and, a property with a team who genuinely cares about your stay, I would recommend the Ohana East Hotel by Outrigger. And, if you're not a kama'aina, I would still recommend this hotel property if you're traveling from outside of Hawai'i to Waikiki. It's a simple hotel, non-fussy with small amenities offered yet, the Ohana East Hotel by Outrigger extends a great location with great value.

We stayed at this resort for 5 nights as a family of two adults and two kids, It was easy walking distance to the beach and shops and restaurants. The room was clean and they provided beach/pool towels, there was a coffee and tea maker, fridge and in room safe, but no microwave or toaster ( I know some of the other hotels in the area provide these). There was a $25 resort fee on top of the room rate which covers internet, and free travel on the pink line to Ala Moana shopping centre. I think most of the hotels charge this which I think is ridiculous as the room rate is already high enough and we had a hire car which we had to pay another $25 a day for parking. The rooms are comfortable enough and the kids enjoyed eating their cereal breakfast on the small balcony, and liked going to the pool/spa after a day at the beach. If you are not planning to hire a car then this hotel would be fine as you have every thing close by and can pay for tours, but if you want to explore on your own I would probably find a hotel that includes either parking or breakfast for better value for money.
user_name:
Deouin L
Perth, Western Australia, Australia

review_body: Hotel was very clean. Pool was a nice size, with a hot tub. Restaurant on premise. We had an unusual shaped room, but it had a nice fridge, hot plate and microwave and queen size bed. The other couple we were with were disappointed that there Room was located near the elevator. So beware of numbers ending in 000. Very nice that we were able to catch city buses and the free trolley from the hotel to the shops.

Standard rooms are very small. It’s like a Motel 6. Shower only — a very small shower and the door which is only 2 feet wide will not open all the way because it hits the toilet. Our Waikiki View is of a construction site. AC is just fan. There is no temperature control. First day in room needed to call maintenance 3 times.

This is the 4th time my wife and I have visited Hawai’i. We have stayed at Ohana East on 3 of the 4 occasions and always found the hotel up to standard.It is well located close to shops, restaurants and the Waikiki beach front.On this occasion I was however a little disappointed. We arrived on a 8-30am flight from Australia arriving at the hotel around 10am. Whilst I had no expectation on early check in, I didn’t expect to be greeted with the reception I received. “ check in is 3pm but if you want to pay US $75 we will prioritise a room”. The lady at reception didn’t even check on room availability?After 2 further attempts (same lady) for a room between 10 & 2 pm, I finally was greeted by Jessie with a completely different and helpful attitude. She rang to find what rooms ere ready and we finally got to our room 2pm.So Come prepared to wait. You can still use the coffee shop, the pool and other facilities.The other thing that disappointed on this occasion was the push for tour desk to sell packages for Wyndham Holiday time share before wanting to help you. This should be an add on.Make sure you request rooms at either end of the building or away from middle pool side. Our room was located next to the 3 lifts and you could hear the movement all night long.Also Come prepared to spend more than you expect when visiting Hawai’i. It has become a haven for Japanese tourists and is now rather expensive.I would still recommend the Ohana, albeit my comments above.

Highly recommend Ohana East. It isn’t right on the beach however it is only a short 5 minute walk to the beach and main road. We did prefer the location as we found it to be a little more quiet. There is construction going on across the road at Kings Village but we honestly didn’t hear any noise and our room was facing it. We were upgraded from a Waikiki view room to an ocean view room which was really nice. Before we even arrived I had been sending a few questions via email which Denise was lovely and helped with my queries. They also provided a cot/crib for my baby. We found all of the staff (reception, bell boys, cleaners) to be very friendly and helpful. Our room was serviced daily & left immaculate. Pool is lovely & clean. The pool did get a little cool in the afternoon when the sun goes behind the buildings. There are literally 4 ABC stores within 5 minute walk (1 on each corner of the block) which are open late if you need any supplies. There also a couple restaurants underneath Ohana East. There was a cafe, Japanese, a steak place & Italian. Don’t bother with the Italian place but the rest were great. The trolley also is only a few minute walk. Oh & there is a place to do your laundry attached to the building which I noticed was also open quite late.

The hotel needs refurbishing, scratched walls and run down with dated fittings. Centrally located but a bit noisey. Not good value or that appealing. The restaurant on the ground floor was good though.

My wife and I stayed in a "1 Bedroom Kitchenette Partial Ocean View" room in the Ohana Waikiki East hotel. The room matched our expectations: it has a living room, bedroom, kitchenette and bathroom. We prefer to have a living room separated from the bedroom when we stay somewhere for a week or longer. The room provides ample storage space. Our room was on the top floor (19th floor) of the building. There is a dedicated elevator serving the top three floors, which goes directly to the lobby and to street level, so we had easy access. The room is decorated in a style and colours which was popular several decades ago, and could use some renewal. However, nothing was broken or damaged, everything worked as intended. The kitchenette is suitable for making coffee and heating up food in the microwave. Don't expect to be able to actually cook a meal. And housekeeping does not clean coffee cups and cutlery: we found out that we had to do that ourselves. Some other reviews talk of noise from neighbouring rooms. We did not experience that, except for one occasion where a baby was audibly crying in the room next-doors. The hotel pool is very small so we didn't bother trying it out.One thing which I did not like is that the hotel room, which you pay for in advance, does not cover the total cost. Several items, such as internet connection, are charged separately and on a daily basis (called "Daily Resort Charge"). So, upon checking out I had to pay another USD 23 for each day of stay. This Daily Resort Charge increased the total cost of stay by about 10%. This pricing strategy is what "budget airlines" do, not "full service airlines". It gives me the impression that Outrigger wants to position itself in the "budget airlines" category instead of the "full service airlines" category.We discovered that Waikiki is actually rather compact and each street, shop or restaurant was easily reachable on foot from the hotel. It does not make much difference which Waikiki hotel you choose: all of them are rather close to each other.Our stay was overshadowed by an incident with the concierge. One day we stopped at the concierge desk, asking for advice about a bus tour around the island. Two men were sitting there. Once we had made our choice and were close to actually booking it, they said that we might be entitled to a discount of up to 50%. From here on it became sketchy. They asked some questions and started to make phone calls. Followed by more phone calls and more questions, which became increasingly more personal ("what is your profession?", "your annual income?", "your nationality?", "need a copy of your photo ID"). This got me really annoyed as we were only discussing a bus tour. Only when I voiced my anger did they disclose that they were setting us up for a promotion tour of Outrigger timesale property. This made me extremely angry, as I was not going to waste time on this and was annoyed that they had already taken so much time from me. I have paid quite some money to stay in this hotel and then I get confronted with such deceitful behaviour of the concierge. I had not expected this. Since that incident have I avoided all hotel staff: if management allows the concierge to behave this way, then they will also allow other customer-facing staff to behave this way. I didn't want to have the risk of being trapped a second time.All in all did the room meet our expectations. The Ohana Waikiki East is a hotel which we will most likely avoid in the future. This was my first stay in an Outrigger property and I must say that the brand has not made a good impression on me. P.S. I gave the same feedback on the hotel's questionnaire after my return home. A manager sent me an email apologizing for the incident. He disclosed to me that one of the two men was the hotel's concierge and the other was a sales representative of the Outrigger timesale company. This was not clear to me when I sat there, as there were no signs indicating this and the men did not disclose this upfront. The manager stopped short of saying whether they will make any changes. I guess not.

Excellent location and pretty good service. Got a free upgrade to an ocean view room, we already felt good on the beginning of the holiday.We traveled with an one-year-old baby, asking help to getting bottle sanitizer and micro-wave. Friendly staffs get those fulfilled. Free Wikiki trollery is like five minutes away only, it's very good value hotel.

I booked here for one night to get over the jet lag. I arrived at 10am and put my bags into storage before heading out to the international mall for lunch. They let me check in early. The lobby was busy, even a bit chaotic with cleaners, guests coming and going etc. The carpet throughout the hotel tells the story, looks like it's from the 1950s. I expected Gidget to pop out any moment. The room was clean and a good size, if a bit dated. This was a workable hotel and did the job. Maybe better for a family stay.
user_name:
cpaterso
New York City, New York

review_body: The staff were very helpful and friendly, the room size at least average in size and always kept very clean.Like some other hotels the lobby is not at ground level requiring use of elevators which has it's disadvantages.We stayed in room 430 (I think) which happened to be next to the door leading to the service elevator used by the room cleaners and it constantly made a loud noise when closing making afternoon rest difficult. Maybe the hotel should consider ensuring the door closer be adjusted so that it does not allow the door to bang shut and/or rubber stoppers to reduce/eleminate the noise. We would never want to stay in that room (or 330, 530, 630 etc) for that reason.

My girlfriend & I arrived at 8.30am in Hawaii after a good flight over. We where taken to our hotel & put our bags in storage as we could not be there until 3pm. As my girlfriend had been at this hotel she said it was alright. So we left our luggage in storage & we caught a long bus into Ala Moana shopping centre. We where pleased to find a coffee & tea shop, so was glad to sit down & plan what we should do till 3pm. That was easy by just walking around & checking out all the different shops they had. Soon we where back at Ohana East Hotel at Waikiki & I signed in & we here taken to our room. It looked a nice room with 2 big beds & a clean bathroom. The cupboard sliding doors felt as if they where not on correctly, so when our bags arrived, we gave the guy a tip & asked about the cupboard. He fixed them up straight away & we decided to g down to Appetito craft pizza & wine bar for dinner. We had a nice dinner & soon went back to our room for a good night sleep. We enjoyed our time staying at Ohana East Hotel in Waikiki.

One week after 18 day cruise for a first-time visit to Honolulu. Close proximity to Waikiki (2 blocks) so far enough from the main strip to have some peace. Clean and comfy room serviced daily, and most reception staff helpful but not always seeming to be enthusiastic to a step further. Pool and spa were enjoyable break from our days out sightseeing. Our major problem was the lack of support to assist us with answers to get medical oxygen and CPAP to work (low US voltage would not operate machines). No staff could assist us as to where we could get assistance, even outside. This was despite the fact they were advised we were bringing medical equipment from Australia almost 8 months in advance. A CLEAR WARNING TO ANY OTHER AUSTRALIANS TRAVELLING WITH MEDICAL EQUIPMENT - YOU NEED A TRANSFORMER, NOT JUST ADAPTOR TO GET ENOUGH PRESSURE TO PUMP.

As a family of three, we loved our stay here. It is clean, great location, with an extremely friendly and accommodating team. We were lucky enough to get an early check in as well.We would definitely stay here again and highly recommend it.

Highly recommend this hotel. A block from the beach without paying beach front prices. Staff was remarkable and incredibly accommodating. Shows signs of wear but considering all the pluses this was easily overlooked. Walking distance to a plethora of shops and restaurants. Free trolley if you don’t feel like walking. $11 airport shuttle. I am used to staying in more upscale hotels but this is a great hotel for the price.

Hotel staff was friendly and helpful, hotel itself was solid. Could use a few updates, but rooms were clean. Walls were pretty thin. Great location with plenty of things within easy walking distance. Would consider it again for a future stay.

Aloha , nice hotel, stay at room 318. room is average and cleaned. but it can accomodate up to 6 person, 2 double bed and 1 sofa bed. good location. closed to beach and pink trolley stop. convenience store (kuai market is at the door step near the elevator entrance) there is also japanese restaurant below the hotel and sim card shop. so you dont have to worry about roaming charges from your mobile provider. special thanks to tracy at reception who allows us to early check in for a small fee. It has been so much help for us, especially travelling with 2 children for the early check in. will definetely come back to the same hotel for for future visit to hawai. have a nice day and mahalo

We had a total of 4 rooms booked with 8 of us on a group holiday. The rooms are neat, clean and a great size. The rooms come with white linen and and bed covers. Our rooms looked out from the back of the hotel across to honolulu. Although the view is only slightly of the ocean it is still spectacular and looks over the international market place. At night it is all lit up.Our room was the king room directly behind the lifts. Although the lifts run off and off all night it didnt bother us as we were heavy sleepers. Although you could hear it if you woke up, it never woke me up. The bonus with these rooms are they have 2 seperate closets and larger balcony than the other rooms. This worked great as we were able to get 10 people in the room comfortably for drinks. Whilst at the hotel the lifts were infuriatingly slow however one was done up in the week were there, one was done up before we arrived and the 3rd i imagine is already complete by now. The pool had all new furniture delivered whilst we were there. There is a cafe located down stairs that does great breakfast, croisants, eggs, acai bowls, coffess and knick knacks etc. There is no food service at this hotel but there is a really cute, intimate italian restaurant located down stairs in front of the hotel. The location is excellent. Walking distance to waikiki beach, the Moana surfrider, the international village, Dukes, the cheesecake factory (we got food posioning there, the line up at night is 45-90 minutes after 6pm). And about 5 minutes walk to the Starbucks Reserve (aussies check this place out).We stayed for 7 nights and the dollar changed during the book now pay later and actually paying. When we held the rooms they were $2100 for the 7 nights and when it came time for paying they were $2400. So if booking on any external websites you are better off paying up front IMO.

The OHANA Waikiki East is a wonderful hotel and the staff are extremely helpful. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. We had a few problems with our trip and they were extremely accommodating to our unique situation.

Our recent stay at Ohana Waikiki East was our second. Check-in and out was a breeze. This is not your 5-star hotel but is perfect for a short stay in Waikiki. The room was spotless, our daily maid was diligent and the location was convenient to all that Waikiki offers. We had a room on the 15th floor with a peek-a boo view of the ocean. Upper floors have a dedicated elevator requiring a key card to operate, a nice layer of security. Rooms have a safe, a reasonable bathroom with the usual toiletries provided. The pool is at the rear and pleasantly quiet although we didn't use it, just sat and read.

FEES! Don't believe the online pricing because it is a lie. They hit you with substantial daily fees on top of the artificially low online prices. Then do you want a place to park? That's $35 more a day. AC never actually managed to fully cool down my room despite being on 24 hours. Noticeable lack of electrical outlets (No place to plug in coffee pot unless you used bathroom). Refrigerator took more than a day just to cool down. Shower is cramped and tough to control with almost no place to put shampoo and stuff. OK it is in a decent location, so that brings it from a 1 to a 2 in the ratings, but just barely....

My family of four (husband, myself and two small children) stayed in a one-bedroom apartment over Christmas for nearly 2 weeks. The highlight of the hotel was the location, everything we needed was within walking distance! We were very lucky to be on the 14th floor, the view of the ocean was just beautiful!! The kids were excited to pull open the curtains every morning and watch Waikiki wake up! Also, the rooms were clean and the staff, especially housekeeping and bell staff were friendly, especially to the kids!Pros:1. Central location:- Food pantry 1 min walk- Waikiki beach 2 min walk- Dukes 3 min walk- Honolulu zoo <20 mins walk- Marakume udon <5 min walk- International market place 1 min walk- Hawaiian Crown Plantation cafe <1min walk- Pink trolley stop 2 min walk2. Spacious, we had a double bed in the bedroom and the pull out sofa bed in the living room and the room was still large enough for the kids to play around in!3. Excellent wifi connection4. Clean! 5. Friendly staff, especially the housekeeping (level 14) and the bell staff6. Gorgeous view of the city and the ocean (level 14)7. Pool was large and deep great for doing laps or having a splash around, spa was a nice way to relax after a day of hiking or shopping. Cons:- Some days the elevators were slow, some days they were fast.- While a lot of reviews say the decor is outdated, i think it adds to the hawaiian charm. Sure, the table and chairs may look outdated but it does the job.

We stayed here in November, the week before and just after Thanksgiving. There was the protesting just next to the hotel but we had a room on the 11th floor so the noise wasn't too bad. We also knew about the protests happening before we arrived in Hawaii and from reading the news, my understanding is that it's over now. This hotel is a bit outdated but compared to other hotels in the area and given it's central location, the price was pretty good. The rooms were a good size, the bed was comfortable but the carpet and furnishings need updating. The staff at the front desk, bellhop and concierge were fantastic. The concierge we spoke with was Adam ( I think) and he was super helpful booking our pearl harbour tour, car hire and luau. The elevators are also being updated at the moment so the middle elevator if you're catching it from the lobby will go down before it goes up. It's annoying but not the end of the world. There's also signage where the elevators are to tell you there is work going on. There is a small gym onsite too which has all the basics. They also provide you a small beach bag with beach towels.This hotel is great if you want to be close to the beach but not right in the hustle and bustle. There's a coffee shop onsite, a convenience store right at the bottom of the escalator and you get free use of the pink line trolley. We liked it because it was affordable, central to everything you need and the staff were great. I would definitely recommend staying here if you're looking for an affordable Waikiki hotel close to the beach but if you're looking for a 5 star hotel this may not be the place for you.

When we landed we were so excited, but our excitement didn't last long.. There was a large group of protesters outside banging drums and shouting slogans. They started at 7 am, and carried on until 10pm, and it got so bad that we didn't even get a chance to sit by the pool. We eventually demanded a room further from the noise, very unfortunate......Otherwise, the little coffee shop was nice, and the rooms were comfortable.

Our first initial contact with reception was very poor. The staff at the front desk were rude, dismissive and not informative. We arrived early and our room was not ready and we were told to come back at check in time 3 hours later, but not given any instructions on where we could leave our luggage or a map of Waikiki or things to do in our wait time. The guests in front of us who had an hour wait were given a waiting room to sit in. This did not start off our trip very well. After that, it got better. The hotel manager and bell staff were extremely helpful and friendly, happy to give us a hand whenever we needed. Hotel itself was very outdated and in a desperate need of refurbishment. Rooms were dusty and falling apart- for example power points and noisy air con. Carpet was gross. Showers didn't always have hot water and pressure was awful. The lifts were undergoing maintenance and took at least 7 minutes to get from level 5 to lobby each time. Location of the hotel was awesome! Close to Waikiki Beach and main strip with restaurants and bars, as well as ABC stores and everything you needed for your stay. Pool towels were also provided and could get new ones as many times per day as needed. Shuttles to main locations around the island could be booked with bell staff and pick up and drop off outside hotel making it super easy.

still the best value best situated hotel particularly for families in Waikiki. Excellent front desk,outstanding housekeeping,spotless pool and surrounds Maybe a little tired in places but all things were attended to and promptly fixed

Spent 5 nights here and it was great. Hotel a little tired but very central to the beach and mini supermarkets. We were very fortunate enough to be upgraded to a kitchenette room so I cooked several nights. Our room (1105) had a huge balcony unlike other rooms. Pool area is nice and the restaurant attached to the hotel is very good. Would definitely return to this lovely hotel.

If you're looking for the Four Seasons, this is not the place. The hotel is dated and the room was really small. However, if you're looking for an affordable hotel less than a five minute walk from Canoe/Queens Beach, this place is perfect! I was traveling by myself and couldn't have asked for a better setup for three nights. In addition, everyone on the staff (Angie, Brian and others) were all VERY helpful. When I didn't like my original room on the second floor because it was right next to the service elevator with a view of nothing but the pool, I asked for another room. Despite getting the original room because I'm sure it was assigned to travelers who'd booked on the cheap via Expedia, I was moved to the 16th floor. The staff asked if I didn't mind a room without a balcony, which was fine with me, and I ended up with room 1625 and a panoramic view looking straight out at the ocean! This was room 1625. If you have a choice, try to get a room as high up as possible and ending in -25. Another huge perk was that my flight back home wasn't until 8pm and I knew that I'd have to check out around noon. Besides giving me a later checkout at 2pm so I could get a hike in, and also allowing me to check my bags for the day, when I returned around 6pm, they allowed me to take a shower and clean up in a hospitality room before heading to the airport. Ka-ching!! In addition, the unrelated breakfast spot that you could access from the lobby had fantastic acai bowls. Get the one with tropical fruit. If I ever return to Waikiki primarily to go surfing, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Very old quite antiquated in comparison to most I have stayed at previously in Honolulu. Small bathroom and room altogether. Great central location to downtown Honolulu with a short walk to the beach. Night food market across the road which has good cheap food with a great atmosphere. Staff were lovely, plenty of hot water and bed was ok.

The hotel is in a great location,the building is old however the service is great staff are very helpful, the rooms are neat, tidy and clean. We had a basic room with a great view the room has everything you need.the only complaint we have is the lifts due to the age of the building they are noisy which we could here from our room and that you had to wait a long time for them to reach your destination however in saying this I would stay there again

Decent but basic room... everything worked just fine. Room was quiet... My only complaint was it did take long for the elevator sometimes. They open the service elevator, which is around the corner, and there was almost no wait for that one, so take advantage of it. The towels were actually really nice... don't expect much of a view from any of the rooms, but super convenient location. It's basically behind the Sheraton Princess Kuilani… so the big supermarket is across the street, along with lots of restaurants, convenience stores etc. Just a 3 minute walk to the beach. Room was a little on the smaller than average size, but such a good value... good help with luggage if needed, friendly lobby staff. I didn't use the pool, but it looked pretty nice from my small balcony.

This Outrigger hotel has been here for ages, so the building isn't new and there are few signs of age, but the rooms are clean and comfortable. The balconies are small, just about enough room for two chairs and a small table. The bathroom is also small, but is big enough. The hotel served its purpose for my wife and I for a weeks stay, but we had to buy ear plugs to allow us to sleep. This was because of the noise from the lift mechanisms - the noise was almost like a constant thunderstorm from 5am until 2am. We were in room 1730, I believe that 1701 and 1702 also have the same problem. I don't know if there is a similar issue on the other floors.
